Articles.Content: I extracted EACH AND EVERY single heat in a Kerbol sized space around that planet, and created...My "Hill" of Absolute Zero Temperature, that'll appear in the Temperature reader.

Now you are the Absolute Zero King. Nobody counts with you, nobody asks your opinion.

But don't upset too much. There is Subzero, he is even less important.

I spray molten rock on your hill. The steam explosion is visible from another galaxy.

I make a hill inside of a black hole, where only I can withstand the crushing gravity.

My singularity.

Your hill got crushed because you say that you're the only one who can withstand that gravity, it also went somewhere else you know nothing about.

I altered reality so that your Black hole turned into a large, comfortably low gravity planet wirh some hills, my hills.

I go to the asteroid that was captured in to a stable orbit around your planet and find a hill

my moon hill
The Moonhill prices made you abandon the town.

Former poster didn't claim the hill, I am king now.

Mount Krimson.

I smash the mountain concave with a single punch and plant a flag on the central uplift.

My 10-mile wide crater with an impact peak (hill)
The river floods the crater, the peak is now an island.

I transmute the entire crater except for the peak into limestone. It decays and the water drains into a funnel leading into a portal.

Your rainy parade.

Yes, they call this place "A hill of melted rubber clothings."

I rip every atom of Iron from it’s place miles around and condense the metal mist into a huge ball with simple motions of my hands. I fling it at the hill and the normally placed spikes shoot out long strands of lightning, setting fire to all the trees around it. 

My magnetic hill.

I get a massive MRI and turn it up to 100000000 Tesla. This fries your brain and makes an evil lightning storm on the hill as I shout, "so as your enemy I take the hill!" Then I nuke it, rebuild it and call it,

My newly built shiny hill.

I commit quantum suicide to become timeless.

The first thing I do floating around, dashing between realities is cleanse the hill with nuclear fire.

You immediately think in third person: \*A blinding flash appears on the horizon, and it grows brighter than a thousand suns. The whole of kerbin is lit with a clarity indescribable with any words in the dictionary. When the light recedes, a vast mushroom-shaped cloud of smoke and incandescent rocks rises up into the sky dozens of miles, and the kerbals fall silent. After a few minutes, a shimmering wave, followed by a deafening thunderclap, washes over the space center, blowing down buildings and stripping trees of their branches.. What used to be the hill  is now massive flying chunks of superheated volcanic rock, or dust trapped in the 50 km high mushroom cloud of the explosion.\*

My 500 megaton explosion crater.
